sentences.english: Did you see the shocking lines collected in Dwelling Narrowness by some netizens?
sentences.chinese: 你看过由网友搜集的《蜗居》雷人台词了吗？

sentences.english: There is chatting service provided in the public toilet, is it ridiculous or the creative?
sentences.chinese: 公厕里推出陪聊服务是创新还是雷人？

sentences.english: Leo: Did you see the shocking lines collected in Dwelling Narrowness by some netizens?
sentences.chinese: 你看过由网友搜集的《蜗居》雷人台词了吗？

sentences.english: I read some startling news today on BBS.
sentences.chinese: 我在留言版上读到了一些雷人的新闻。

sentences.english: Lucy: So what did you say about the shocking lines?
sentences.chinese: 你说的那个雷人台词是怎么回事？

sentences.english: Every day presents more cases, but the most recent case is stunning.
sentences.chinese: 每天都会发生更多的事，最近一桩事非常雷人。

definition: (Internet slang) (of a situation, video clip etc) to make one think "wtf!"
spoof (web-based genre in PRC, acquiring cult status from 2005, involving humorous, satirical or fantastical videos, photo collections, texts, poems etc)
silly talk or "mo lei tau" (Cantonese), genre of humor emerging from Hong Kong late in the 20th century
(archaic) light, bright (variant of 冏[jiong3])/(since c. 2005) (slang) emoticon signifying embarrassment, shock, helplessness etc
to burst out laughing/hilarious/burst of laughter
